channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chipotle launches summer promotion, which will see it giving out $1 million in free burritos
item.description: Also returning is the Chipotle card, which brings free burritos for a year.

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs has the inside track on friend Jony Ive’s collaboration with OpenAI—but still wants to see Apple succeed
item.description: Ive says a driver for the io-OpenAI design is the fact that "humanity deserves better" than an "uneasy" relationship with technology.

item.title: The transformation of women’s sports in Saudi Arabia is no mirage. Just ask the women
item.description: Women were barred from stadiums prior to 2018. Today, there’s a premier women’s soccer league with global sponsorships.

item.title: Two Big Fights over DOGE go to Supreme Court
item.description: What cases are left on the Supreme Court’s emergency docket? Here’s a look.

item.title: Employers Need Help Managing Workers Who Are Taking Second Jobs
item.description: A new survey of U.S. employees shows many are turning to additional employment because they’re under financial strain.

item.title: I tried doing everything with AI on a Pixel 9a, but it didn’t go as planned
item.description: Going into my time reviewing the Google Pixel 9a, I had this grand idea to transform myself into “AI Man.” Google has made a big to-do about how it’s ...

item.title: 3 Mistakes to Avoid When Bringing AI Into Your Company
item.description: Here’s why you should treat generative AI like a new team member, and not just another type of tech solution.

item.title: Gen Z men studying an MBA will see a 75% salary bump—that’s 25% more than women with the same qualification
item.description: Male MBA graduates make $36,000 more than their female counterparts and the disparity begins with their first job out of school.

item.title: Wildfires unleash thousands of evacuations in Canada and ‘unhealthy’ air quality in these U.S. states

item.title: My Employee Is Bad at His Job but Keeps Saying He’s Doing Great
item.description: His self-hype is out of touch with reality. Is this salvageable?

item.title: Rite Aid store closures update: List of doomed locations keeps growing, now includes more than a third of all stores
item.description: As it prepares to sell off its remaining assets in the wake of a second bankruptcy filing , Rite Aid continues to move aggressively to close pharmacy ...

item.title: 23andMe’s Anne Wojcicki moves to reopen auction with support from a Fortune 500 company
item.description: (Corrects paragraph 3 to say 23andMe filed for bankruptcy in March, not April) The founder of 23andMe, Anne Wojcick i, has asked a U.S. judge to reope...

item.title: The Stock Market Isn’t Buying the Bears’ Gloomy Outlook
item.description: The S&P 500 just posted its best May since 1990.

item.title: Syrian stock exchange reopens after a 6-month hiatus as part of U.S.-led push for a new free market economy
item.description: Stock trading resumed in Damascus after a six-month pause that began in December.

item.title: Damascus stock exchange reopens in Syria as the war-torn country aims to rebuild its economy
